proposedResponse.summary: Explain _._NuGet convention and point to companion WPF package
proposedResponse.body:
Thanks for the report! The `netcoreapp3.1` directory in `SkiaSharp.Views.Forms` intentionally contains only `_._` placeholder files — this is a [standard NuGet convention](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/create-packages/supporting-multiple-target-frameworks#architecture) that declares framework compatibility without bundling a dedicated assembly.

The actual `SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.dll` for netcoreapp3.1 lives in the companion **`SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.WPF`** package. The `.targets` file in `build/netcoreapp3.1/` checks for this and will emit a build error (SK1001) if you're building a WPF app without it installed:

```
The SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.WPF package needs to be installed in addition to the SkiaSharp.Views.Forms package in order to support Xamarin.Forms with WPF.
```

So the netcoreapp3.1 support IS there — you just need both packages:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Forms" Version="2.88.0-preview.179" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.WPF" Version="2.88.0-preview.179" />
```

Note: Both `netcoreapp3.1` and `Xamarin.Forms` have reached end-of-life. For new projects, consider migrating to SkiaSharp 3.x with `SkiaSharp.Views.Maui` or `SkiaSharp.Views.WPF` on .NET 8+.

actions.description: Close as answered — packaging is by-design, workaround provided
